annotation: In the manuscript, this notation appears in the middle of the story, just after the reported direct speech of the tailor to the dogs, and just before he dies. Annotations such as this appearing in the midst of other recordings are not unusual (BJK 3.06).
danish_manuscript: Her i Ersted sagde de forhen: en Lus en Kabus, en træsku, flæsken og glæset hwås i Ædste der siger de i o.s.v. Jakob
english_manuscript: Here in Ersted, they used to say: "En tuds, en kabuds, en trådsku, fladsken og gladsed, hwads, i Ædste", there they say in, etc. Jakob.
danish_publication: Her i Ersted sagde de forhen: En tuds, en kabuds, en trædsku, fladsken og gladsed, hwads, i Ædste (Ersted), Jakob.
english_publication: Here in Ersted, they used to say: “En tuds, en kabuds, en trådsku, fladsken og gladsed, hwads, i Ædste (Ersted), Jakob.

etk_index.heading_english: Our forebears' way of thinking and spiritual life
